Hydra.Distance: 20.67 ly, 6.34 pc (i.e., distance to its nearest star, LHS 3003)
Hydra.Notes: Hydra is the largest of the 88 modern constellations, measuring 1303 square degrees, & is also one of the longest at over 100 degrees. It is commonly represented as a water snake. It should not be confused with the similarly named constellation of Hydrus. Its brightest star is Alphard (designated Alpha Hydrae), an orange giant of magnitude 2.0, 177 light-years from Earth.
captions: The constellation Hydra as it can be seen by the naked eye.
